inclusion.criterion: Dual chronic hepatitis C and B
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is a 55-year-old man diagnosed with HCV 2 years ago and the recent coinfection with HBV.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The medical records show previous positive HCV RNA tests

inclusion.criterion: HBsAg positive for more than 6 months
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Treatment naïve for the hepatitis disease or have had treatment failure to previous interferon monotherapy or lamivudine therapy
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is on IFN, RBV and direct antiviral drugs for the past 6 months

inclusion.criterion: Elevated serum ALT levels at least 1.5 times the upper limit of normal, documented on two occasions (at least one month apart), within six months prior to enrollment
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient presents with elevated serum ALT levels

inclusion.criterion: Liver biopsy findings compatible with the diagnosis of chronic liver disease
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The recent biopsy was negative for hepatocellular carcinoma and was only remarkable for chronic inflammation compatible with a chronic viral hepatitis

inclusion.criterion: Adequate liver reserve (defined as equal to or better than Child-Pugh Class A)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Drug addicts or history of alcohol abuse
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin <12.0 gm/dl for females and <13.0 gm/dl for males
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Signs or symptoms of hepatocellular carcinoma
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The recent biopsy was negative for hepatocellular carcinoma

exclusion.criterion: Investigational drug > 6 weeks prior to the first dose of study drug
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 55-year-old man diagnosed with HCV 2 years ago and the recent coinfection with HBV. He has been on IFN, RBV and direct antiviral drugs for the past 6 months.
